subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
Organ Metabolic Rate-Specific Rate of Living Theory
Stress and Energy Efficiency Rate of Living Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on how reduced core body temperature lowers metabolic rate and oxidative damage, extending lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how environmental temperature affects metabolic rate and aging in poikilotherms, accelerating aging at higher temperatures.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic regulation of longevity modulated by temperature effects on metabolism and aging in poikilotherms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Revisits rate of living theory including temperature effects on metabolic rate and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows how cold exposure affects metabolic rate and longevity, linking temperature to metabolic damage and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Examines metabolic rate and longevity correlations across species with consideration of temperature effects on metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses metabolic rate and lifespan relationships with emphasis on energy expenditure and temperature influences.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Applies rate of living theory to yeast, highlighting metabolic rate effects on lifespan influenced by temperature-dependent biochemical kinetics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radical production as the key mechanism linking metabolic rate to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links metabolic rate to lifespan via oxidative damage from mitochondrial respiration and caloric restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Original and modern reinterpretation of rate of living theory emphasizing ROS accumulation from metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Supports metabolic rate as a fundamental driver of aging through aerobic respiration and free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic correlations in Drosophila linking metabolic rate, ROS production, and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Energy expenditure and oxidative damage from aerobic metabolism as causes of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Metabolic rate linked to oxidative damage and survival, with mechanisms to mitigate ROS effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Organ Metabolic Rate-Specific Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on organ-specific metabolic rates and their direct relationship to aging, distinct from whole-body metabolic rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Organ Metabolic Rate-Specific Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links spontaneous locomotor activity and metabolic rate to lifespan, emphasizing organismal energy expenditure.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Constant Respiration Cycles Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes a fixed total number of respiration cycles as a fundamental lifespan determinant, linking metabolic rate and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replication Limit Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on finite stem cell replication capacity as a rate of living mechanism distinct from metabolic rate but related to cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress and Energy Efficiency Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes stress resistance and energy efficiency as determinants of lifespan, linking stress to metabolic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress and Energy Efficiency Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects stress, energy efficiency, and hormesis to aging, expanding rate of living theory beyond simple metabolic rate.
